season.translation[0].definitions[0].def: one of the main periods into which a year is divided, each of which has a particular type of weather. The seasons are spring, summer, autumn, and winter
season.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: the effect on plants as the seasons start to change
season.translation[0].definitions[1].def: a period of time in a year during which a particular activity takes place, or during which something usually happens
season.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: the first game of the season
the end of the football season
The racing season starts in June.
Some footpaths are closed during the shooting season.
African rivers turn to hard mud during the dry season.
The planting season is in spring, with harvest in the fall.
He was caught fishing out of season.
The season for strawberries  (=when they are available to buy)  usually starts in early June.
season.translation[0].definitions[2].def: the time of the year when most people take their holidays
season.translation[0].definitions[2].not: the festive season British English (=Christmas and New Year)
season.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: There are two boat trips a day, more in high season.
We arrived at the height of the tourist season  (=the busiest time).
season.translation[0].definitions[3].def: the time in each year when new styles of clothes, hair etc are produced and become fashionable
season.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: This season’s look is fresh and natural.
season.translation[0].definitions[4].def: a series of films, plays, television programmes etc that are shown during a particular period of time
season.translation[0].definitions[4].exa: Glyndebourne’s season opens with a performance of Tosca.
The network has several new dramas lined up for the fall season.
a new season of comedy on BBC1
season.translation[0].definitions[5].def: the time of the year when animals are ready to have sex
season.translation[0].definitions[5].exa: Their dog was coming into season.
season.translation[0].note_box[0].headin: – Meaning 2: a period of time in a year during which a particular activity takes place, or during which something usually happens
season.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: The club has had another successful season.
It's been a disappointing season for Arsenal.
The football season will be starting soon.
Autumn was traditionally the hunting season.
The roads are always busy during the holiday season.
It's almost impossible to get a hotel room in the tourist season.
In the rainy season, roads became a quagmire.
The growing season is short in these mountainous areas.
More people are choosing to go abroad for the festive season.
season.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to add salt, pepper etc to food you are cooking
season.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Mix and season to taste  (=add the amount of salt etc that you think tastes right).
season.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to prepare wood for use by gradually drying it
season.translation[3].definitions[0].def: a period of time in the year when most business is done, or the time of year when something happens
season.translation[3].definitions[0].exa: A full shuttle service is not expected until after the summer tourist season.
You can get some cheap travel deals out of season (=during the period of time when most people do not travel).
